intro: Stevia amambayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay stevia, is a perennial shrub native to the subtropical regions of Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is notable for containing high levels of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has gained interest in modern herbal and food industries.
